eu.lestard.easydi

Class EasyDI

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.lestard.easydi.EasyDI

  • public class EasyDI
extends Object

    EasyDI main class.

    A typical usage looks like this:

    EasyDI easyDI = new EasyDI();

MyClass instance = easyDI.getInstance(MyClass.class);

        Returns:
        an instance of the given type.

      • bindInterface

        public <T> void bindInterface(Class<T> interfaceType,
                              Class<? extends T> implementationType)

        This method is used to define what implementing class should be used for a given interface.

        This way you can use interface types as dependencies in your classes and doesn’t have to depend on specific implementations.

        But EasyDI needs to know what implementing class should be used when an interface type is defined as dependency.

        Hint: The second parameter has to be an actual implementing class of the interface. It may not be an abstract class!

        Parameters:
        interfaceType - the class type of the interface.
        implementationType - the class type of the implementing class.
        T - the generic type of the interface.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the first parameter is not an interface or the second parameter is an interface or an abstract class.

      • bindProvider

        public <T> void bindProvider(Class<T> classType,
                             Provider<T> provider)

        This method is used to define a Provider for a given type.

        The type can either be an interface or class type. This is a good way to integrate third-party classes that aren’t suitable for injection by default (i.e. have no public constructor…).

        Another use-case is when you need to make some configuration for new instance before it is used for dependency injection.

        Providers can be combined with Singleton’s. When a type is marked as singleton (has the annotation Singleton and there is a provider defined for this type, then this provider will only executed exactly one time when the type is requested the first time.

        Parameters:
        classType - the type of the class for which the provider is used.
        provider - the provider that will be called to get an instance of the given type.
        T - the generic type of the class/interface.

      • markAsSingleton

        public void markAsSingleton(Class type)

        This method can be used to mark a class as singleton.

        It is an alternative for situations when you can’t use the Singleton annotation. For example when you want a class from a third-party library to be a singleton.

        Parameters:
        type - the type that will be marked as singleton.
